meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a biotype.
meanings.sent1: The bityopic plants in the garden have unique features.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the biotypic traits of different animal species.
meanings.sent3: The biotypic flowers seemed to dance in the breeze.
meanings.sent4: Her biotypic personality shone through in her artistic creations.
meanings.sent5: The biotypic landscape painted a vivid picture of biodiversity.

meanings.definition: Of or pertaining to a biotype.
meanings.sent1: The biotypic classification helped in understanding the ecosystem.
meanings.sent2: The researcher focused on the biotypic distribution of insects.
meanings.sent3: The biotypic study led to some unexpected discoveries.
meanings.sent4: His biotypic observations revealed patterns in nature.
meanings.sent5: The biotypic analysis provided valuable insights into the environment.

meanings.definition: Having the characteristics of a biotype.
meanings.sent1: The biotypic fish species thrived in the clean water.
meanings.sent2: The biotypic birds adapted well to their specific habitats.
meanings.sent3: The biotypic behavior of the animals amused the visitors.
meanings.sent4: The biotypic traits of the plants were carefully documented.
